lg.l: To the TUNE of Old Simon the King.
I.
NOW the Whigs and their Friends are confounded,And all their Designs are made known,
Which so strongly have smelt of the Round-headAnd Treason of forty-one;
For all their Pious Pretensions To Property, Liberty, Laws,
Are found to be only InventionsTo bring in the Good Old Cause.For all their, &c.II.
By the Struggle and Pother they've made To subvert the Laws of the Nation,
And have Rules of Government laidIn their Antimonarchical Fashion.
As appear'd at the DOCTOR's Tryal, And in their own Words is exprest;
They the CHURCH's Doctrines deny all,By persecuting her Priest.As appear'd, &c.
III.
By prolonging a chargeable War, To the Ruine of Credit and Trade;
When, more to our Honour by far,A lasting Peace might ha' been made.
Tho all we have got by the Bargain, Is the Loss of our Money and Men;
And we'd been left not worth a Farthing,Hadn't stood our Friend,Tho all we, &c.
IV.
No more of the Maryrdom Murther, They think it high time 'twas forgot;
Tho' they'd carry'd those Schemes on further,But that we discover'd their Plot:
If our QUEEN shall be told to her Face That her Title on them must depend;
What else cou'd they mean? But her GraceMust beware of the self-same End.If our QUEEN, &c.
V.
Setting up an Elective King,And extinguishing all the Right Line,
Was a Geud and a Godly thing,And most worthy the Whigs Design.
Church and State under Cure must be put,For their crazy State of Health,
To Calvin's Geneva Cut,And a Boorish Commonwealth.Church and State, &c.
VI.
But Thanks to the Friends of the CHURCH,Who have rescu'd her Majesty's Right;
Now her Foes are all left in the Lurch,And will burst with meer Malice and Spite.
May England for ever be blestWith a Ministry Loyal and True;
Then we'll hope for many Years Rest,And the Gallows may claim her due.May England, &c.
VII.
Let the Names of a Whig and a ToryNo longer disquiet the Nation;
Since we aim at the CHURCH's Glory,And pray for this Reformation;
viz.
May every Factious Professor, And all our Zealous Pretenders,
Submit to the QUEEN and Successor,Our Nation's Brave Defenders.May every Factious, &c.
VIII.
Or else may they have their Desert, And the Ax and the Rope have their Due;
That the Hangman may grow more expert,And in time be as rich as a Jew.
Then this Health let us now begin, All Joy to great ANNE and her Right,
A Glorious Reign to our QUEEN,And when she has occasion we'll fight.Then this Health, &c.
